actions.committee: Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to extend the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act of 1973 for 90 days.
short_title: Ninety-day Extension of the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act

summary.text: Ninety-day Extension of the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act of 1973 - Extends the provisions of the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act until November 30, 1975. Sets the ceiling price for the first sales of old oil, as defined by this Act, at $5.25 per barrel beginning September 1, 1975. Sets the ceiling price for the first sales of new oil, as defined by this Act, at $11.50 per barrel and as adjusted according to this Act.

titles.title: Ninety-day Extension of the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act
A bill to extend the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act of 1973 for 90 days.
